name: Adherent Ember
Mat-desc: pieces of charcoal, which the spell consumes
descr:
You stoke one to three pieces of charcoal into clinging embers of elemental fire to lob or shoot at your foes. As an action, you can make a ranged spell attack to throw one of the embers at a target within 30 feet, dealing 1d4 + your spellcasting ability modifier fire damage on a hit. 

You can also use the embers as ammunition for a sling or slingshot. When you hit with a weapon attack using an ember as ammunition, the weapon deals its normal damage but with its type converted to fire.

After you hit a target with an ember, it attaches to it for the duration of the spell and emits 5 feet of dim light. The next time a target with an attached ember takes damage that matches this spell’s damage type, the ember is destroyed in a detonation and deals 1d4 fire damage to the attached target. The ember is harmlessly destroyed if it is submerged in a liquid, the attached target takes any cold damage, or a creature within reach uses its action to remove it. 

If an ability modifies this spell’s damage type to cold, then the ember is harmlessly destroyed whenever the target takes any fire damage rather than cold damage.

 

Charge: This is a spell that can be Charged, modifying its effects. Costs and effects are as follow:

  • 1 Mana: You can create up to six embers when you cast the spell.
  • 1 Mana: The ranges for spell attacks and weapon attacks that use the embers as ammunition are doubled.
  • 1 Mana: The first ember to detonate before the spell ends deals 1d12 fire damage instead of 1d4.
  • 2 Mana: Whenever the embers detonate, creatures within 5 feet of the target also suffer the damage.

name: Astral Mote
descr:
You draw radiant energy into a little mote of light and direct it towards a target within range, making the mote streak through the air like a shooting star. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes 1d8 radiant damage.

 If you cast this spell from a space that has an unobstructed view to the sky above, you can choose to have the mote originate from the sky instead of your hand. When you do, the damage die increases to 1d12 and the attack originates from the sky above the target for the purposes of determining what cover they benefit from.

Charge: This is a spell that can be Charged, modifying its effects. Costs and effects are as follow:

  • 1 Mana: On a hit, the target sheds 10 feet of dim light until the end of your next turn. For this duration, being @Compendium[undertaking.conditions.YE63H7VLOHW7NFHO]{Invisible} does not grant the target any benefits as its silhouette glows.
  • 1 Mana: Create an additional mote, directing the attack towards the same or a different creature within range.
  • 2 Mana: Create two additional motes, directing the attacks towards the same or different creatures within range.

name: Captivate
descr:
You make yourself extremely engaging to another creature, capturing its full attention. One creature you can see within range must make a Wisdom (Save) check. On a failed save, the creature must include you as a target for any attacks and harmful spells or abilities it attempts until the end of its next turn. This effect only restricts the creature’s valid targets, it does not (on its own) provoke hostility from a creature that otherwise would not be inclined to harm you.

Succeed or fail, for the next minute the creature has disadvantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks to perceive creatures other than you while it is able to see you. This effect immediately ends if the creature is attacked or harmed.

name: Deposition
descr:
You cause the humidity to freeze and cling to a creature within range, chilling it and making sudden bursts of movement difficult. The creature must succeed on a Constitution (Save) check or take 1d8 cold damage and lose the ability to take reactions until the start of its next turn.

 

Charge: This is a spell that can be Charged, modifying its effects. Costs and effects are as follow:

  • 1 Mana: Upon failing the Constitution (Save) check, the creature’s movement speed is halved until the end of its next turn.
  • 1 Mana: The cold damage is increased to 2d8.
  • 2 Mana: The cold damage is increased to 3d8.

name: Dread Blade
descr:
You draw forth shadowy energy and shape it into a murky, ephemeral blade. Whenever you cast this spell, a shadowy dagger, sickle, shortsword, or hatchet appears in your empty hand and lasts until the spell ends. The weapon’s damage is converted to necrotic, and you can choose to use your spellcasting attribute modifier in place of Strength or Dexterity for attack and damage rolls you make with it. Any extra bonuses that would apply to your spell attacks for this cantrip also apply to the blade.

The weapon temporarily dissipates when held by a creature other than you. If you end your turn not holding the weapon, or if it has been temporarily dissipated, it reappears in your empty hand if you have one, otherwise the spell ends.

As part of the action you use to cast the spell, you can immediately make a single weapon attack with the weapon.

Charge: This is a spell that can be Charged, modifying its effects. Costs and effects are as follow:

  • 1 Mana: You can create a second weapon from the list, but it must have the Light trait.
  • 1 Mana: The weapon gains the trait Thrown (20/60), or its ranges are doubled if it already had it. The weapon reappears in your hand after each thrown attack you make with it.
  • 2 Mana: The weapon deals an additional die of damage on hit.

name: Prying Whispers
descr:
You point at a creature within range that can hear you (though it need not understand you) and utter a wordless, cryptic whisper, which the creature hears without source in a language they understand invoking its deepest insecurities. The creature must make a Wisdom (Save) check.  On failure, they suffer the following effects:

  • They take 1d6 psychic damage as their deepest insecurities wrack their mind.
  • The first time they hit with an attack before the end of their next turn, they must roll the damage twice and use the lower result.

 

Charge: This is a spell that can be Charged, modifying its effects. Costs and effects are as follow:

  • 1 Mana: The creature must roll damage twice and use the lower result for all attacks it makes before the end of its next turn.
  • 1 Mana: The psychic damage is increased to 2d6.
  • 2 Mana: The psychic damage is increased to 3d6.

name: Salvo
descr:
You reach out and create a concussive burst erupting against a creature or object that is not being worn or held within range. A creature targeted by this spell must succeed on a Constitution (Save) Check against your spell save DC or take 1d8 force damage and be pushed 5 feet away from you. An object targeted by this spell takes the damage automatically and is pushed if it is Medium or smaller and nothing is affixing it in place.

Charge: This is a spell that can be Charged, modifying its effects. Costs and effects are as follow:

  • 1 Mana: The target is pushed an additional 10 feet.
  • 1 Mana: The sonic damage is increased to 2d8.
  • 2 Mana: The sonic damage is increased to 3d8.

name: Suspend Disbelief
Mat-desc: a small pot of paints, dyes, or pigments
descr:
With a flourish of magic and a short prescription you magically alter the scenery to better fit your creative vision. You create one of the following effects within range:

  • You alter the text present on an object to say something else or render it illegible. This effect lasts one hour. A creature can perceive the unaltered version of the text with a successful Intelligence (Investigation) check against your spell save DC.
  • You instantly clean or bloodstain one surface, worn garment, or medium or smaller object. A creature can determine the blood created by this effect to be fake with a successful Wisdom (Medicine) check against your spell save DC.
  • You create the sound of a voice speaking a single word, or any other short non-verbal sound such as thunder, an animal noise, or a crowd’s cheer. The sound originates from a point you can see within range. A creature can determine that the sound is an imitation with a successful Wisdom (Insight) check against your spell save DC.
  • You create an image no larger than 15 feet in any dimension and styled like a painting on one undecorated surface within range such as a blank sheet of parchment or plain wall. When viewed from up close, the image appears to be hastily made and lacking artistry.
  • You instantly light or snuff a single non-magical light source such as a candle, lantern, chandelier, or small campfire. You can also dim a light source for 1 hour, suppressing the dim light emitted by it and reducing its bright light to dim light.

name: Create Miasma
descr:
A cloud of virulent vapors expands to fill a 5-foot cube within range and lingers there for the duration, permeating into the lungs and skin of any creature who dares enter it. When a creature starts its turn in the miasma or enters a miasma it has not already entered this turn, it must succeed on a Constitution (Save) Check or take 1d4 poison damage and then become infected with the Commoner’s Cold disease (detailed below). An infected creature can repeat the save check at the end of each of its turns, ending the disease on a success.
    If the creature fails its Constitution (Save) check 5 times, they stop making the save, and the disease remains indefinitely. Each time the infected creature completes a long rest, it can repeat the save, gaining a +1 bonus for each dawn since its infection.

Commoner's Cold: The creature's immune system is weakened. The first time each turn the infected creature takes poison damage, it suffers 1d4 additional poison damage.

Charge: This is a spell that can be Charged, modifying its effects. Costs and effects are as follow:

  • 1 Mana: The miasma's poison damage is increased to 2d4.
  • 2 Mana: The size of the cloud increases to a 10-foot cube.

name: Brittle Beam
descr:
A corrosive beam of harsh light streaks from your finger toward a target, depositing a thin coating of acid wherever it touches. Make a ranged spell attack against either a creature or an object that is not being worn or carried.
    If the spell attack hits a creature, it takes 3d8 acid damage and the acid mars its worn or wielded equipment or natural weapons. The first time the creature hits with a weapon attack with any of these weapons before the start of your next turn, it must subtract your spellcasting attribute modifier (minimum 1) from the damage it deals.
    If the spell attack hits an object, it takes 3d8 acid damage and is vulnerable to the damage of the next weapon attack that hits it.

Charge: This is a spell that can be Charged, modifying its effects. Costs and effects are as follow:

  • 1 Mana: The acid damage increases to 6d8 against objects.
  • 3 Mana: The acid damage increases to 6d8.
  • 1 Mana: On a hit, you can choose to concentrate on the spell for up to 1 minute, causing the acid to cling more harshly than before. While you maintain concentration, subtract your spellcasting attribute modifier (minimum 1) from the damage of all weapon attacks the creature makes.

name: Camouflage
descr:
You blanket a creature with illusory magic that subtly muddles visual details to resemble their hiding spot, reducing the effort required to escape the notice of others. If the target’s surroundings allow it, they can attempt to Hide immediately as a non-action when this spell is cast. For the spell’s duration, the target can attempt to Hide again as a minor action.

In addition, creatures not actively searching for the target have a -3 to their Awareness to spot them so long as they remain still.

Charge: This is a spell that can be Charged, modifying its effects. Costs and effects are as follow:

  • 1 Mana: In addition, any sounds the target makes unintentionally are muffled. The target ignores the penalties to Dexterity (Stealth) checks imposed by wearing armor with the Noisy trait, and they no longer need to remain still to benefit from the -3 to others’ Awareness.
  • 1 Mana: The spell’s range becomes Self. All creatures hiding and remaining still within 10ft of you are harder to spot. Creatures have a -3 to their Awareness to spot the affected creatures.

name: Cojoin Familiar
Mat-desc: crystals, herbs, and oils worth 10gp, which the spell consumes
descr:
You forge a bond with a lesser spirit from beyond the material plane, entwining its essence with your very soul. The familiar appears in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of you, taking the form of an animal that uses the statistics of an Attack Dog, Cat, Crow, Eel, Frog, Homing Bird, Lizard, Pig, Serpent, or Tarantula, except that its creature type is Celestial, Fey, or Fiend and it does not have its own hit points. 

Whenever your familiar would take damage, you must instead subtract the total (after modifiers like any resistances the familiar has) from your own hit points. If both you and your familiar are caught in the same hostile area of effect, your familiar is immune to the effect but you suffer disadvantage on any save checks to resist the effect made during the current turn. If you are reduced to zero hit points, your familiar is instantly banished to a pocket dimension.

In combat, you control your familiar and it acts on your turn. Its action can only be used to take the Dash, Disengage, Hide, or Self-Defense actions, unless you use your minor action to command it to take a different action, for example, the Attack action. The familiar cannot take Desperate Actions. As a minor action, you can banish your familiar to a pocket dimension or summon your banished familiar to an unoccupied space within 5 feet of you. The familiar is @Compendium[undertaking.conditions.3CQC3JEY2C3Y721F]{Incapacitated} and does not need to breathe while it is inside the pocket dimension. Finally, whenever you cast a spell with a range of Touch, you can choose to target creatures as if you were in your familiar’s space, but your familiar must be within 100 feet of you and doing so consumes its reaction.

While your familiar is within 100 feet of you, you can also use your minor action to peer through its eyes for the rest of the turn, becoming @Compendium[undertaking.conditions.ADW4EH0NKRDCRCA4]{Blinded} and @Compendium[undertaking.conditions.WK17M9FZR08DRUP1]{Deafened} to your own surroundings for the duration but gaining all senses your familiar has. If you die, your familiar is released from its bond.

You can only have one familiar at a time. If you cast this spell when you already have a familiar, you can choose to replace its form with one from the list above. If you decide to get rid of your familiar, you can permanently dismiss it as an action, ending the spell.

name: Conduit Shock
descr:
A jolt of electricity reaches from you toward a creature within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target, ignoring any cover bonuses resulting from other creatures obstructing the attack’s path. On a hit, the creature takes 1d10 lightning damage. Hit or miss, the target and any creature standing in a line between you and the target must make a Dexterity (Save) Check to avoid an arc of lightning that briefly flickers between you and your target. Creatures in the line take 2d6 lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much on a success.

Charge: This is a spell that can be Charged, modifying its effects. Costs and effects are as follow:

  • 1 Mana: The spell’s range increases to 30 feet.
  • 1 Mana: The lightning damage on a successful save is increased to half damage.
  • 1 Mana: The attack deals 1d8 additional lightning damage to its target for each creature in the line that fails the save.
  • 3 Mana: The lightning damage on a failed save increases to 4d6.

name: Heighten Senses
Mat-desc: a carrot for sight, the ear of a beast for hearing, a downy feather for touch, a thin cracker for taste, or a spicy pepper for smell
descr:
You sharpen a creature’s sense of sight, hearing, touch, taste, or smell. For the duration the target has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) and Wisdom (Instinct) checks where the chosen sense is applicable. This also has the effect of granting them a +5 bonus to Awareness in situations where the enhanced sense would apply.

Charge: This is a spell that can be Charged, modifying its effects. Costs and effects are as follow:

  • 1 Mana: You enhance all five senses instead of just one, but the spell requires all five material components if you don’t have a focus.
  • 1 Mana: You additionally gain a sixth sense, allowing the target to sense the presence of @Compendium[undertaking.conditions.YE63H7VLOHW7NFHO]{Invisible} creatures within 30ft of them, whether corporeal or metaphysical. While the target cannot actually see the creature, the Invisible condition does not grant any benefits against the target.

name: Magic Missive
Mat-desc: A signed book worth at least 5gp, which the spell partially consumes
descr:
When you cast this spell, you can communicate with any creature that has signed the book you hold. Address a creature by name and dictate a message consisting of up to 30 words to it. The book flips open to its first empty page and the words you dictate appear on the page in your handwriting as you speak them. The spell fails if you address your message to a creature that has not written its own name on the inside cover of the book, or if there are no remaining blank pages in the book.

Once you finish dictating the message, the page tears itself from the book, folds into a glider, and takes flight at a speed of 180 feet per round (20 miles per hour). If the recipient is within the spell’s range, the message travels to them by the shortest route that is safe for it to do so, otherwise it travels to a random point within the spell’s range. When the message arrives it unfolds and hovers gently for 6 seconds or until held. The message, when held by the target creature, imparts an understanding that it can dictate a reply of 30 words of their own, which the spell inscribes on the back of the sheet. When their reply is finished, the page refolds and travels back to you at the same speed, as long as you are still on the same plane of existence as it. The spell ends when the reply reaches you or if the recipient does not reply within 10 minutes of receipt.

The message deftly avoids collisions as it travels.  The seeking magic fades from the message if it takes damage, has an object attached to it, or is manually unfolded during transit. While under the effect of the spell, the page can’t be marked or altered by mundane means. If all paths to the message’s target are cut off (for example the message or target is inside a closed room) it taps gently against the obstacle blocking it until a path becomes available or the spell’s duration expires.

 

Charge: This is a spell that can be Charged, modifying its effects. Costs and effects are as follow:

  • 1 Mana: The spell’s range is increased to 75 miles (the rough equivalent of three day’s travel by horse).
  • 3 Mana: The spell’s range encompasses the plane of existence you are currently on.

name: Reassurance
descr:
You assuage feelings of panic and desperation in one creature you can see, steeling its resolve to act. Choose one of the following effects:

  • If the creature has taken a desperate action since its last turn, it can act normally on its next turn. Even with this benefit, it can’t take another desperate action before the start of its next turn.
  • If the creature is suffering from one or more effects causing it to be @Compendium[undertaking.conditions.KJXJ0T5RPNC51N4V]{Charmed} or @Compendium[undertaking.conditions.UK95BQ45TGSD5Q3V]{Frightened} you can force it to immediately repeat its (Save) check against one of those effects at advantage.

 

Charge: This is a spell that can be Charged, modifying its effects. Costs and effects are as follow:

  • 1 Mana: You can choose both effects.
  • 1 Mana: If you choose to make the target repeat its (Save) check and it fails, it makes all subsequent (Save) checks to end that effect at advantage.

name: Song of Adventure
Mat-desc: a musical instrument worth at least 1cp
descr: You produce a short melody, which continues on its own and builds to fill the space around you with energizing music. The music instills creatures of your choice that can hear you with a sense of expeditiousness, granting them an additional 15 feet of movement the first time they are within 30 feet of you each turn.

name: Vitalizing Prose
descr:
Your words stir heroism in a creature and staunch its wounds. One creature within range that can hear you (though it need not understand you) regains hit points equal to 1d4 + your spellcasting modifier. This spell has no effect on a creature that is @Compendium[undertaking.conditions.9KB959MRZ0H4IT4C]{Unconscious} or @Compendium[undertaking.conditions.WK17M9FZR08DRUP1]{Deafened}.

Desperate: When you cast this spell as a desperate action, it gains the ability to affect creatures that were knocked @Compendium[undertaking.conditions.9KB959MRZ0H4IT4C]{Unconscious} if used during the turn they fell unconscious. This healing does not prevent the creature from falling @Compendium[undertaking.conditions.RK3DF56CKMQUV6DM]{Prone}. In addition, the target also gains 1d4 temporary hit points.

Charge: This is a spell that can be Charged, modifying its effects. Costs and effects are as follow:

  • 1 Mana: The hit points restored increases to 2d4 + your spellcasting modifier.
  • 2 Mana: Target an additional creature within range.

name: Cauterize
Mat-desc: A bandage and a dab of oil
descr:
You reach out and sear a creature’s open wounds. The creature takes 2d6 fire damage and must make a Dexterity (Save) Check to try and pull away, which it can choose to fail. On a failed save, you choose one of the following to happen:

  • All of the creature’s stacks of @Compendium[undertaking.conditions.R54LQEKSDXNQ3N75]{Bleeding} are removed, and it suffers an additional 1d6 fire damage for each stack removed.
  • The creature resists the spell’s fire damage and gains temporary hit points equal to the fire damage taken. This damage cannot reduce a creature below 1 hit point. Additionally, all of the creature’s stacks of @Compendium[undertaking.conditions.R54LQEKSDXNQ3N75]{Bleeding} are removed, gaining an additional 1d6 temporary hit points per removed stack.

Charge: This is a spell that can be Charged, modifying its effects. Costs and effects are as follow:

  • 2 Mana: After resolving the spell’s effects, re-apply half of the stacks of @Compendium[undertaking.conditions.R54LQEKSDXNQ3N75]{Bleeding} the spell removed.
  • X Mana: For each extra Mana you spend, up to your charge limit, you can also remove one stack of @Compendium[undertaking.conditions.R54LQEKSDXNQ3N75]{Bleeding} from yourself. If the target fails its save, you can include these in the total stacks of @Compendium[undertaking.conditions.R54LQEKSDXNQ3N75]{Bleeding} removed when determining the spell’s effects on the target.

name: Corporeal Semblance
Mat-desc: A lock of hair, vial of blood, or other fragment taken from a societal creature in its natural form, which the spell consumes
descr:
You temporarily change the race of one willing creature you touch, giving them the form, appearance, and racial abilities of a creature from a different lineage. For the duration, the target replaces all of their racial abilities with those of the creature that the spell’s material components were taken from, ignoring any changes to attributes, maximum hit points, lifespan, proficiencies, languages, or equipment. 

The target’s new form loosely resembles that of the copied creature such that they could be mistaken for a relative, but not to the extent that anyone would confuse the two. Within these constraints, the target can fine-tune aspects of their new appearance, such as hairstyle, body markings, age, and body shape, as long as they are possible for the new race and relatively similar to the copied creature.

The magic of the spell provides the target with a basic understanding of their new form’s capabilities and helps acclimate them to any unusual externalities such as new senses, different forms of locomotion, or an alien set of vocal cords.

This spell struggles to perfectly recreate any magical aspects the target’s new form may have. Abilities that would restore a creature’s mana can only restore up to 1 mana total across the transformation’s duration. Additionally, the target must use its own mana to cast any spells of 2nd level or higher granted by their new race, even if they would normally be able to cast them without mana.

Charge: This is a spell that can be Charged, modifying its effects. Costs and effects are as follow:

  • 0 Mana: The spell no longer requires Concentration but only lasts 1 hour.
  • 1 Mana: The target’s clothing and armor alter and resize to accommodate their new form, but the material and style remains the same. They remain in this altered state for the spell’s duration, even when doffed.
  • 2 Mana: The spell consumes an additional valid material component, taken from a different creature. The target gains the core race abilities from one and the branch race abilities from the other, and their new form resembles a hybrid of the two.

name: Corrosive Wash
descr:
You conjure a shower of corrosive acid upon a target within range. The target must make a Dexterity (Save) check. On a failed save, it takes 2d10 acid damage and becomes coated in bubbling acid, temporarily weakening its defenses. If the creature is benefiting from natural armor, medium armor, heavy armor, or a shield then it suffers a -2 penalty to AC until the end of your next turn. This reduction to AC cannot be combined with other effects that reduce AC, such as multiple castings of this spell.

On a successful save, the creature takes half of the damage and suffers no other effects.

Charge: This is a spell that can be Charged, modifying its effects. Costs and effects are as follow:

  • 1 Mana: The AC reduction applies to any target that fails their save, regardless of what armor or shields they have.
  • 2 Mana: The AC penalty increases to -3.
  • 2 Mana: In addition to targeting a creature, you can cause the acid to permanently eat holes in one Large or smaller object not being worn or carried or one 5-foot section of wall that is within 5 feet of the target. As well as weakening the structural integrity of the object or surface, any creature that attempts to use it as cover gains one tier lower of obstruction from the object than it normally would. For example, a creature fully obscured by it would only gain the benefits of three-quarters cover. Weapons affected by this deal a damage die size smaller.

name: Escape
descr:
With a startling shout, you momentarily transform into a harmless flying cloud of vapor, beasts, or spirits. While transformed in this way, your size becomes Tiny, you have the ability to fly, and you gain an additional 30 ft of movement this turn. 

You revert to your normal form once you have moved 30 ft, you attempt to take any other actions, or you end your turn. If you revert in a space too small to contain you, you take 5 force damage and are forced back along the path you took until there is enough space to accommodate you.

When you transform, all equipment you are wearing or carrying transforms with you, and you automatically escape any @Compendium[undertaking.conditions.FGVFFYGPAFQGZ5RP]{Grappled} or @Compendium[undertaking.conditions.1EK5V6KTYAWC6S69]{Restrained} conditions caused by non-magical sources. Magical effects causing you to be @Compendium[undertaking.conditions.FGVFFYGPAFQGZ5RP]{Grappled} or @Compendium[undertaking.conditions.1EK5V6KTYAWC6S69]{Restrained} are only suppressed while you are transformed.

Charge: This is a spell that can be Charged, modifying its effects. Costs and effects are as follow:

  • 1 Mana: If used as a Desperate Action, you gain advantage on Dexterity (Save) Checks and an additional +2 AC until the end of the interrupted creature’s turn.
  • 2 Mana: One willing creature within 5ft of you is also transformed and carried with you. When your transformation ends they are deposited in the nearest empty space.

name: Ophidian Kiss
descr:
Your teeth grow into vicious fangs, dripping with deadly venom. Make a melee spell attack against a creature within 5 feet. On a hit, the creature takes 2d6 poison damage and gains the @Compendium[undertaking.conditions.R54LQEKSDXNQ3N75]{Bleeding} condition. Hitting a creature that is already at the maximum stacks of @Compendium[undertaking.conditions.R54LQEKSDXNQ3N75]{Bleeding} inflicts one level of @Compendium[undertaking.conditions.ERBR3AG01H4N1L91]{Exhaustion} until the bleeding is cured, as long as it was not already suffering from @Compendium[undertaking.conditions.ERBR3AG01H4N1L91]{Exhaustion} resulting from this spell. 

For the spell’s duration, you can repeat the spell attack against any creature within 5 feet as an action.

Charge: This is a spell that can be Charged, modifying its effects. Costs and effects are as follow:

  • 1 Mana: Until the spell ends, you can repeat the spell attack in place of a weapon attack when a creature provokes an Attack of Opportunity from you.
  • 2 Mana: The poison damage increases by 1d6.
  • 3 Mana: Creatures afflicted with @Compendium[undertaking.conditions.R54LQEKSDXNQ3N75]{Bleeding} from this spell are also @Compendium[undertaking.conditions.9X088PM7H5U2S1HQ]{Sickened} until the @Compendium[undertaking.conditions.R54LQEKSDXNQ3N75]{Bleeding} is cured.

name: Snowslide
descr:
A cascade of snow and ice sweeps through a 20-foot cube centered on a point you choose within range. When you cast this spell, choose one side of the cube (excluding the top and bottom) to be the side of egress. Each creature within the cube must make a Constitution (Save) Check. On a failed save, a creature takes 3d8 cold damage and is moved directly towards the chosen egress side until it is ejected from the cube or is stopped by an obstacle. On a successful save, a creature takes half damage and is not moved. Afterwards, the snow rapidly melts and dissipates, leaving behind only small clumps and puddles.

Charge: This is a spell that can be Charged, modifying its effects. Costs and effects are as follow:

  • 1 Mana: Snow coats the ground in the cube for the next minute. While snow-covered, the area is considered difficult terrain. The snow within each 5-foot space melts early when it or a creature in it is subjected to any fire damage.
  • 2 Mana: The size increases to a 30-foot cube.

name: Static Spark
Mat-desc: A piece of fur and a glass sphere
descr:
You hurl a ball of electricity at a creature within range, making a ranged spell attack. On a hit, the target takes 2d10 lightning damage and becomes charged with static electricity. On a miss, the spell ends. For the duration, you can use your action to make a ranged spell attack against any other creature within 15 feet of the charged creature, dealing 2d6 lightning damage on a hit.

Charge: This is a spell that can be Charged, modifying its effects. Costs and effects are as follow:

  • 1 Mana: If you miss the initial spell attack, the spell does not end and the target creature’s space becomes charged with electricity instead. The rest of the spell functions as normal but with the words “charged creature” replaced with “charged space”.
  • 1 Mana: Instead of making a spell attack, you can touch a willing creature to harmlessly charge them with electricity instead. The spell functions as normal, skipping the initial attack damage.
  • 4 Mana: The subsequent spell attacks can be triggered as a minor action.
